file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 31-31-05-04 - FDR IMPACT SWITCH - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FDR IMPACT SWITCH - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the FDR impact switch. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 31-31-05-000-802-A FDR IMPACT SWITCH - REMOVAL ALL 31-31-05-400-802-A FDR IMPACT SWITCH - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 31-31-05 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 31-31-05-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. FDR IMPACT SWITCH - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the FDR impact switch. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Fuselage rear section Ι - Right side D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To get access to the rear electronic compart- GSE 036 Platform - Hydraulic, Aircraft ment E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Rear electronic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) On the circuit breaker panel, open the FDR circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it. (3) Put the hydraulic platform (GSE 036) to the necessary height to get access to the rear electronic compartment. (4) Open the access door 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (5) Remove the thermo-acoustic insulation blanket from the rear left side of the ceiling. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 31-31-05 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A NOTE: During the removal, be careful not let the nuts (4) fall because you could not find them easily. (1) Disconnect the electrical connector (1). (2) Hold the nuts (4) behind the frame (5) and loosen the screws (2). (3) Remove the impact switch (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 31-31-05 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL FDR Impact Switch - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 271 REAR ELECTRONIC COMPARTMENT B DET. A 5. FRAME 4. NUT 1. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 3. IMPACT 2. SCREW SWITCH DET. B 145AMM310013.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 31-31-05 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 31-31-05-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. FDR IMPACT SWITCH - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the FDR impact switch. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Fuselage rear section Ι - Right side D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To get access to the rear electronic compart- GSE 036 Platform - Hydraulic, Aircraft ment E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Rear electronic compartment I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A NOTE: During the installation, be careful not let the nuts (4) fall because you could not find them easily. (1) Put the impact switch (3) in its installation position. (2) Hold the nuts (4) behind the frame (5) and tighten the screws (2). (3) Connect the electrical connector (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 31-31-05 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the thermo-acoustic insulation blanket on the rear left side of the ceiling. (2) Close the access door 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (3) Remove the hydraulic platform (GSE 036). (4) On the circuit breaker panel, remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from the FDR circuit breaker and close it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 31-31-05 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
